poem:
Title: "Mason's Lament"

In the stolid house of promise,
Dust-choked hands dally, delayed.
Unintricate slow suns circling,
Imperfect bricks in careless array.

The budget, our tatty Mosaic,
Is as scant as the school master's pay.
They christened the children "special,"
And yet, we let the blueprint fray.

£105m, a dishonest day's labour.
Time, the unkind taskmaster, hath waylaid.
March marches on without progress;
Tomorrow's scholars in today's shade.
